results.title: Sing Out for Wales
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Royal National Eisteddfod is an annual celebration of the Welsh language and culture, particularly as expressed in mass choirs and poetry. The miserable weather conditions of this particular Eisteddfod do little to dampen the enthusiasm of the participants as they gather to elect the prize-winning bard of the year.

results.title: Oktoberfest in Munich
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Oktoberfest began in 1910 to celebrate the marriage of King Ludwig I to Princess Therese and has grown to become the world’s largest beer festival. This program provides an insight into the activities that make up the 16 day festival including the street parade featuring Munich’s brewery bands, the amusement park and the food and beer halls that cater for the 7 million annual visitors.

results.title: Ghost of the Spanish Warrior
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Moors and Christians festival of Alicoy in Alicante, Spain celebrates the defeat of the Moors by Christians after 500 years of occupation which left an indelible mark on Spanish culture and architecture. Led by a boy representing St. George, the town’s patron saint, groups of ‘crusaders’ stage a symbolic battle against the ‘moors’.

results.title: A Day for Being Irish
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Every year since 1606 the town of Ballycastle in County Antrim, Northern Ireland has held the Lammas Fair to which people come to trade, barter and generally have a good time. Originally the fair was set up for the Scottish overlords of the time to trade their horses for black cattle and other goods that they needed. The nearby islanders of Rathlin also participate in the fair by selling seaweed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: A World of Festivals
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description: A series which captures the appeal, colour and cultural tradition of European festivals and their locations. The rituals, forms of behaviour, dress, music, folklore and fun behind each event are explored, so that a fascinating and colourful picture of other societies’ culture and traditions is presented.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: Carnival in France
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
For two months before Easter the French town of Limoux celebrates the end of winter with the oldest continuous carnival in France. As well as showing preparations for the carnival and the carnival itself the video also visits the neighbouring medieval town of Carcassonne and shows the making of the unique sparkling wine of the area, Blanquette de Limoux.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: Belgium Salutes an Emperor
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Homogon, one of the greatest festivals of the middle ages. In the 16th century it was staged by the people of Brussels to entertain an emperor and his royal court. Today it is recreated in perfect detail. Among the 1300 performers are a group of titled aristocrats of Belgium who play the parts of their ancestors.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: The Venice Gondola Pageant
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Once a year the gondoliers of Venice compete for the honour of being the fastest gondolier. This video looks at all of the pageantry which accompanies this event as well as touring Venice itself, describing a little of its history and crafts, including the construction of the gondolas themselves, and what it is like to live there.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: Viking Sacrifice in Shetland
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Viking fire festival which is held every year in the Shetland Islands celebrates the end of winter and the coming of spring. Preparations take many months and involve the entire community of this isolated outpost of the British Isles. As well as the festival itself there are glimpses of the life of the people who live here.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: Thailand: new destinations
results.creator_credit: Colin Baker, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Cinegroup
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
Nestled among mountain ranges and blessed with a cool, temperate climate we journey to some of the lesser known areas of Thailand. We take a jungle trek with the women of the Karen tribe, visit the Emerald Lake in the Angthong Marine National Park and participate in the beautiful Candle Festival at Sukhothai. The paradisaical Thai landscape is full of beautiful forests and rivers and we visit an elephant park at Surin. We glimpse Thailand’s natural beauty as well as the rites, customs and lives of its Buddhist population.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Baker, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Cinegroup
results.description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
Nestled among mountain ranges and blessed with a cool, temperate climate we journey to some of the lesser known areas of Thailand. We take a jungle trek with the women of the Karen tribe, visit the Emerald Lake in the Angthong Marine National Park and participate in the beautiful Candle Festival at Sukhothai. The paradisaical Thai landscape is full of beautiful forests and rivers and we visit an elephant park at Surin. We glimpse Thailand’s natural beauty as well as the rites, customs and lives of its Buddhist population.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
Nestled among mountain ranges and blessed with a cool, temperate climate we journey to some of the lesser known areas of Thailand. We take a jungle trek with the women of the Karen tribe, visit the Emerald Lake in the Angthong Marine National Park and participate in the beautiful Candle Festival at Sukhothai. The paradisaical Thai landscape is full of beautiful forests and rivers and we visit an elephant park at Surin. We glimpse Thailand’s natural beauty as well as the rites, customs and lives of its Buddhist population.
